title: Above NRU, nominal wages rise, SRAS shifts left

content.question: How does the automatic adjustment mechanism move the economy to potential real gross domestic product (GDP) in the long run when current real GDP is above potential GDP?

choices.label: Nominal wages fall, shifting the short-run aggregate supply curve to the right.
Nominal wages fall, shifting the short-run aggregate supply curve to the left.
Nominal wages do not change, shifting the short-run aggregate supply curve to the right.
Nominal wages rise, shifting the short-run aggregate supply curve to the right.
Nominal wages rise, shifting the short-run aggregate supply curve to the left.

content.answer: Nominal wages rise, shifting the short-run aggregate supply curve to the left.
